title: 3-year-old boy dies of gunshot wound in Simpsonville home
content:
Investigators spent hours Monday piecing together the moments they said led to the fatal shooting of a 3-year-old boy inside his Simpsonville home.
The child was identified as Michael Kyron Boyles, the Greenville County Coroner's Office said. Deputy Chief Steve Moore of the Simpsonville Police Department said the incident happened just before 2 p.m. while the child was alone in a bedroom.
"We know the child was in the bedroom. We know the gun was in the bedroom," Moore said.
It was not known how the child got to the handgun or how the gun was fired, authorities said. An autopsy was scheduled for Tuesday.
The mother was in the living room at the time with another child, a 2-year-old who wasn't injured, Moore said.
Family members could be seen outside the home Monday afternoon clutching each other.
Neighbors said the family had moved into the home on Garfield Lane in the Bryson Meadows subdivision less than a year ago.
"I can't imagine," one neighbor said. "It must be devastating to lose a child this close to Christmas."
A forensics team and the Greenville County Coroner's Office was also on the scene.
"Our thoughts and prayers are with the family," he said.
